data:
Corrie Primary is a larger than average primary school in Denton, Manchester. In light of the changes to the National Curriculum and with languages becoming compulsory as of September 2014, we are keen to up level teachers skills and knowledge in the subject. This will promote a positive attitudes towards the learning of a foreign language and hopefully raise standards.

Three members of staff will attend an 8 day residential course in Carcasonne, France at various times over a two year period. These three members of staff will be from across each Key Stage to ensure progress of teaching and dissemination of information through Key stage meetings to ensure all members of staff have the opportunity to access new teaching strategies and resources. 

Our aims are to improve the teaching and learning of languages across the school and to transform the attitudes currently held by the pupils towards languages. The project hopes to promote a love of language learning that will continue into Key Stage 3 and beyond. We aim to raise aspirations within all children, especially targeting pupils currently funded by Pupil Premium, 

The course we have found has a variety of activities which will improve  language proficiency and develop teachers confidence in using and teaching French. Participants will by involved in the local life , experiencing the French culture first hand to raise  inter cultural awareness as well as their subject knowledge. All this will provide participants with a range of effective and engaging ideas to encourage active learning and facilitate excellence in the primary languages classroom.

We are hopeful that the project will have a successful impact on not only the school but also the local community around Denton by promoting a positive attitude towards a foreign language and towards different cultures from abroad. We hope to promote a love for practical language learning through games and songs which the children will carry throughout their primary years and hopefully into later schooling leading to them choosing to continue with a language.
